.class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit DateTimeFormatInfo extends System.Object implements class System.ICloneable, class System.IFormatProvider
Public NotInheritable Class DateTimeFormatInfo Implements ICloneable, IFormatProvider
public ref class DateTimeFormatInfo sealed : ICloneable, IFormatProvider

summary.span: 提供關於日期和時間值格式的特定文化特性資訊。

span.span: Provides culture-specific information about the format of date and time values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 內容類別包含特定文化特性資訊來格式化或剖析日期和時間值，如下所示：The properties of the class contain culture-specific information for formatting or parsing date and time values such as the following: - 用來格式化日期值的模式。The patterns used to format date values. - 用來格式化時間值的模式。The patterns used to format time values. - 一周天數的名稱。The names of the days of the week. - 年的月份的名稱。The names of the months of the year. - 上午The A.M. 到下午and P.M. 指示項用於時間值。designators used in time values. - 日期以行事曆。The calendar in which dates are expressed. 本節內容：In this section: - [具現化 DateTimeFormatInfo 物件Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object](#instantiating) - [而異的文化特性For the Invariant Culture](#instantiating_Invariant) - [特定文化特性For a Specific Culture](#instantiating_Specific) - [中性文化特性For a neutral culture](#instantiating_neutral) - [目前的文化特性For the current culture](#instantiating_Current) - [DateTimeFormatInfo 和動態資料DateTimeFormatInfo and dynamic data](#dynamic) - [格式化日期和時間Formatting dates and times](#Formatting_dates_times) - [格式字串和 DateTimeFormatInfo 屬性Format strings and DateTimeFormatInfo properties](#properties) - [修改 DateTimeFormatInfo 屬性Modifying DateTimeFormatInfo properties](#Modifying) ## 具現化 DateTimeFormatInfo 物件Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object A物件可代表的文化特性而異、 特定文化特性、 中性文化特性或目前的文化特性的格式設定慣例。A object can represent the formatting conventions of the invariant culture, a specific culture, a neutral culture, or the current culture. 本章節將討論如何具現化每一種物件。This section discusses how to instantiate each type of object. ### 具現化文化特性而異的 DateTimeFormatInfo 的物件Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object for the invariant culture 文化特性而異表示不區分文化特性的文化特性。The invariant culture represents a culture that is culture-insensitive. 它以英文語言，但不是能在任何特定英語系國家/地區。It is based on the English language, but not on any specific English-speaking country/region. 雖然特定文化特性的資料可以是動態的而且能夠變更以反映新的文化特性慣例或使用者喜好設定，而異的文化特性的資料不會變更。Although the data of specific cultures can be dynamic and can change to reflect new cultural conventions or user preferences, the data of the invariant culture does not change. 您可以具現化物件，以下列方式表示的格式設定慣例的文化特性而異：You can instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of the invariant culture in the following ways: - 所擷取的值屬性。By retrieving the value of the property. 傳回物件是唯讀的。The returned object is read-only. - 藉由呼叫無參數建構函式。By calling the parameterless constructor. 傳回的 物件是讀取/寫入。The returned object is read/write. - 所擷取的值屬性從所傳回的物件屬性。By retrieving the value of the property from the object that is returned by the property. 傳回物件是唯讀的。The returned object is read-only. 下列範例會使用每一種方法來具現化物件，代表文化特性而異。The following example uses each of these methods to instantiate a object that represents the invariant culture. 然後會指出物件是否為唯讀。It then indicates whether the object is read-only. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/create1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/create1.vb#1)] ### 特定文化特性的 DateTimeFormatInfo 物件具現化Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object for a specific culture 特定文化特性表示播放特定國家/地區的語言。A specific culture represents a language that is spoken in a particular country/region. 例如，EN-US 是特定文化特性，表示在美國，說出的英文語言和 EN-CA 是特定文化特性，表示在加拿大的英文。For example, en-US is a specific culture that represents the English language spoken in the United States, and en-CA is a specific culture that represents the English language spoken in Canada. 您可以具現化物件，代表特定文化特性的格式化慣例，以下列方式：You can instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of a specific culture in the following ways: - 藉由呼叫方法，並擷取傳回的值物件的屬性。By calling the method and retrieving the value of the returned object's property. 傳回物件是唯讀的。The returned object is read-only. - 藉由傳遞靜態方法代表的文化特性的物件其您想要擷取的物件。By passing the static method a object that represents the culture whose object you want to retrieve. 傳回的 物件是讀取/寫入。The returned object is read/write. - 藉由呼叫靜態方法，並擷取傳回的值物件的屬性。By calling the static method and retrieving the value of the returned object's property. 傳回的 物件是讀取/寫入。The returned object is read/write. - 藉由呼叫類別建構函式和擷取的值傳回物件的屬性。By calling the class constructor and retrieving the value of the returned object's property. 傳回的 物件是讀取/寫入。The returned object is read/write. 下列範例說明每一種來具現化物件，並指出產生的物件是否為唯讀。The following example illustrates each of these ways to instantiate a object and indicates whether the resulting object is read-only. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/create1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/create1.vb#3)] ### 中性文化特性的 DateTimeFormatInfo 物件具現化Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object for a neutral culture 中性文化特性代表文化特性或語言無關的國家/地區。它通常是一或多個特定的文化特性的父代。A neutral culture represents a culture or language that is independent of a country/region; it is typically the parent of one or more specific cultures. 例如，Fr 是中性文化特性的法文語言和 FR-FR 文化特性的父代。For example, Fr is a neutral culture for the French language and the parent of the fr-FR culture. 您可以具現化物件，您所建立的相同方式代表中性文化特性的格式化慣例物件，代表特定文化特性的格式設定慣例。You can instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of a neutral culture in the same ways that you create a object that represents the formatting conventions of a specific culture. 此外，您可以擷取中性文化特性物件擷取特定文化特性中性文化特性屬性和擷取所傳回的物件及其屬性。In addition, you can retrieve a neutral culture's object by retrieving a neutral culture from a specific culture's property and retrieving the object returned by its property. 除非的父文化特性代表文化特性而異，傳回的物件是讀取/寫入。Unless the parent culture represents the invariant culture, the returned object is read/write. 下列範例會說明這些方法具現化代表中性文化特性的物件。The following example illustrates these ways of instantiating a object that represents a neutral culture. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/create1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/create1.vb#2)] > [!NOTE] > 在.NET framework 1.0 透過[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]，嘗試擷取物件會反映中性文化特性的格式化慣例，會擲回例外狀況。In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 through [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)], trying to retrieve a object that reflects the formatting conventions of a neutral culture throws a exception. 不過，由於中性文化特性缺少特定文化特性格式資訊，因為它是獨立於特定國家/地區。However, a neutral culture lacks culture-specific formatting information, because it is independent of a specific country/region. 而不是填入物件一般的值，會傳回.NET Framework反映的格式設定慣例的特定文化特性的物件是中性文化特性的子系。Instead of populating the object with generic values, the .NET Framework returns a object that reflects the formatting conventions of a specific culture that is a child of the neutral culture. 例如，物件中性 en-us 文化特性會反映 EN-US 文化特性的格式化慣例和物件 fr-fr 文化特性會反映為 FR-FR 文化特性的格式設定慣例。For example, the object for the neutral en culture reflects the formatting conventions of the en-US culture, and the object for the fr culture reflects the formatting conventions of the fr-FR culture. 您可以使用下列程式碼來判斷哪一個特定文化特性中性文化特性所表示的格式設定慣例。You can use code like the following to determine which specific culture's formatting conventions a neutral culture represents. 這個範例會使用反映來比較中性文化特性的屬性與特定的子系文化特性的屬性。The example uses reflection to compare the properties of a neutral culture with the properties of a specific child culture. 它會考慮為相等，如果它們是相同的日曆類型的兩個行事曆，且西曆行事曆，如果其屬性有相同的值。It considers two calendars to be equivalent if they are the same calendar type and, for Gregorian calendars, if their properties have identical values. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/instantiate6c.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/instantiate6c.vb#6)] ### 目前的文化特性的 DateTimeFormatInfo 物件具現化Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object for the current culture 您可以具現化物件，代表目前的文化特性的格式化慣例，以下列方式：You can instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of the current culture in the following ways: - 所擷取的值屬性。By retrieving the value of the property. 傳回物件是唯讀的。The returned object is read-only. - 所擷取的值屬性從所傳回的物件屬性。By retrieving the value of the property from the object that is returned by the property. 傳回物件是唯讀的。The returned object is read-only. - 藉由呼叫方法物件，代表目前的文化特性。By calling the method with a object that represents the current culture. 傳回物件是唯讀的。The returned object is read-only. 下列範例會使用每一種方法來具現化物件，代表目前的文化特性的格式設定慣例。The following example uses each of these methods to instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of the current culture. 然後會指出物件是否為唯讀。It then indicates whether the object is read-only. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/create2.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/create2.vb#4)] 您可以建立的可寫入物件，代表下列其中一種在目前的執行緒文化特性的慣例：You can create a writable object that represents the conventions of the current thread culture in one of these ways: - 藉由擷取物件中的任何三個先前的方式和呼叫方法在傳回物件。By retrieving a object in any of the three previous ways and calling the method on the returned object. 這會建立原始檔案的副本物件時，不同處在於其屬性是`false`。This creates a copy of the original object, except that its property is `false`. - 藉由呼叫方法來建立物件，代表目前的文化特性，然後再使用其屬性，以擷取物件。By calling the method to create a object that represents the current culture, and then using its property to retrieve the object. 下列範例說明每個讀取/寫入具現化的方式物件，並顯示的值及其屬性。The following example illustrates each way of instantiating a read/write object and displays the value of its property. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/instantiate2.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/instantiate2.vb#7)] 在 Windows 中，使用者可以覆寫的部分中格式化和剖析透過作業所使用的屬性值**地區和語言**控制台 中的應用程式。In Windows, the user can override some of the property values used in formatting and parsing operations through the **Region and Language** application in Control Panel. 比方說，其文化特性是英文 （美國） 的使用者可能選擇顯示長時間 （格式為 hh: mm:） 使用 24 小時制時間值，而不是預設 12 小時制，（在格式 h:mm: ss tt 中)。For example, a user whose culture is English (United States) might choose to display long time values using a 24-hour clock (in the format HH:mm:ss) instead of the default 12-hour clock (in the format h:mm:ss tt). 討論方式擷取的物件之前都反映出這些使用者覆寫。The objects retrieved in the ways discussed previously all reflect these user overrides. 如果這是讓人困擾，您可以建立並不會反映使用者的物件會覆寫 （和也是讀取/寫入，而不是唯讀） 藉由呼叫建構函式，並提供值`false`如`useUserOverride`引數。If this is undesirable, you can create a object that does not reflect user overrides (and is also read/write instead of read-only) by calling the constructor and supplying a value of `false` for the `useUserOverride` argument. 下列範例將說明這點系統目前文化特性是英文 （美國） 和其完整時間模式已從 h:mm: ss tt 預設值變更為 hh: mm:。The following example illustrates this for a system whose current culture is English (United States) and whose long time pattern has been changed from the default of h:mm:ss tt to HH:mm:ss. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/instantiate3.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/instantiate3.vb#8)] ## DateTimeFormatInfo 和動態資料DateTimeFormatInfo and dynamic data 格式化日期和時間值所提供的特定文化特性的資料類別是動態的如同所提供的文化特性資料類別。The culture-specific data for formatting date and time values provided by the class is dynamic, just like cultural data provided by the class. 您不應做任何假設穩定性的值相關聯的物件與特定物件。You should not make any assumptions about the stability of values for objects that are associated with particular objects. 僅提供文化特性而異，及其相關聯的資料物件很穩定。Only the data provided by the invariant culture and its associated object is stable. 應用程式工作階段之間，或應用程式執行時，可以變更其他資料。Other data can change between application sessions or even while your application is running. 有四個主要的來源的變更：There are four major sources of change: - 系統更新。System updates. 文化特性的偏好設定，例如慣用的行事曆或慣用的日期和時間格式會隨著時間改變。Cultural preferences such as the preferred calendar or customary date and time formats change over time. Windows Update 時若發生這種情況，包括變更以特定文化特性的屬性值。When this happens, Windows Update includes changes to the property value for a particular culture. - 取代的文化特性。Replacement cultures. 類別可以用來取代現有的文化特性的資料。The class can be used to replace the data of an existing culture. - 階層式屬性值的變更。Cascading changes to property values. 許多與文化特性相關的屬性可以變更在執行階段，這又會導致若要變更的資料。A number of culture-related properties can change at run time, which, in turn, causes data to change. 例如，以程式設計方式或透過使用者的動作，可以變更目前的文化特性。For example, the current culture can be changed either programmatically or through user action. 當發生這種情況時，所傳回物件屬性變更為與目前的文化特性相關聯的物件。When this happens, the object returned by the property changes to an object associated with the current culture. 同樣地，文化特性的曆法可能會變更，從而會導致變更為許多屬性值。Similarly, a culture's calendar can change, which can result in changes to numerous property values. - 使用者喜好設定。User preferences. 應用程式的使用者可以選擇覆寫一些透過控制台地區及語言選項的目前系統文化特性相關聯的值。Users of your application might choose to override some of the values associated with the current system culture through the regional and language options in Control Panel. 例如，使用者可能會選擇不同的格式顯示日期。For example, users might choose to display the date in a different format. 如果屬性設定為`true`，屬性物件也會從使用者設定。If the property is set to `true`, the properties of the object is also retrieved from the user settings. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容物件 (例如，如果選取的行事曆不是其中一個所指示的行事曆屬性)，方法和屬性的值的結果未定義。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the object (for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the calendars indicated by the property), the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. 資料不一致，使用中的所有使用者可覆寫屬性的可能性降到最低建立物件時，會初始化物件。To minimize the possibility of inconsistent data, all user-overridable properties of a object are initialized when the object is created. 仍有可能會不一致，因為是不可部分完成的物件建立或使用者覆寫程序都不相關的值時，建立物件。There is still a possibility of inconsistency, because neither object creation nor the user override process is atomic and the relevant values can change during object creation. 不過，這種情況應該很少發生。However, this situation should be extremely rare. 您可以控制使用者覆寫中會反映代表文化特性的系統文化特性與相同的物件。You can control whether user overrides are reflected in objects that represent the same culture as the system culture. 下表列出的方式物件可以擷取，並且表示產生的物件是否反映使用者覆寫。The following table lists the ways in which a object can be retrieved and indicates whether the resulting object reflects user overrides. |CultureInfo 和 DateTimeFormatInfo 物件來源Source of CultureInfo and DateTimeFormatInfo object|反映使用者覆寫Reflects user overrides| |---------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------| |`CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.DateTimeFormat` 屬性`CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.DateTimeFormat` property|[是]Yes| | 屬性 property|[是]Yes| | 方法 method|[是]Yes| | 方法 method|否No| | 建構函式 constructor|[是]Yes| | 建構函式 constructor|取決於值`useUserOverride`參數Depends on value of `useUserOverride` parameter| 除非有充足的理由，否則您應該採用使用者覆寫，當您使用格式化和剖析使用者輸入或顯示資料的用戶端應用程式中的物件。Unless there is a compelling reason to do otherwise, you should respect user overrides when you use the object in client applications to format and parse user input or to display data. 對於伺服器應用程式或自動執行應用程式，您不應該。For server applications or unattended applications, you should not. 不過，如果您使用物件是明確或隱含來保存字串形式的日期和時間資料，您應該使用反映的格式設定慣例的文化特性而異，或者您的物件應該指定自訂日期和時間格式字串，讓您不論文化特性。However, if you are using the object either explicitly or implicitly to persist date and time data in string form, you should either use a object that reflects the formatting conventions of the invariant culture, or you should specify a custom date and time format string that you use regardless of culture. ## 格式化日期和時間Formatting dates and times A物件用於隱含或明確地所有日期和時間格式化作業。A object is used implicitly or explicitly in all date and time formatting operations. 這些需求包括下列方法的呼叫：These include calls to the following methods: - 所有日期和時間格式化方法，例如和。All date and time formatting methods, such as and . - 主要的複合格式方法，後者為。The major composite formatting method, which is . - 其他複合格式方法，例如和。Other composite formatting methods, such as and . 所有的日期和時間格式設定作業進行使用實作。All date and time formatting operations make use of an implementation. 介面包含單一方法。The interface includes a single method, . 傳遞給這個回呼方法物件，代表提供的格式資訊所需的型別。This callback method is passed a object that represents the type needed to provide formatting information. 方法會傳回該類型的執行個體或`null`如果它無法提供類型的執行個體。The method returns either an instance of that type or `null` if it cannot provide an instance of the type. .NET Framework 包含兩個格式化日期和時間的實作：The .NET Framework includes two implementations for formatting dates and times: - 類別，代表特定文化特性 （或特定國家/地區中的特定語言）。The class, which represents a specific culture (or a specific language in a specific country/region). 在日期和時間格式的作業，方法會傳回與相關聯的物件及其屬性。In a date and time formatting operation, the method returns the object associated with its property. - 類別，可提供其相關聯的文化特性的格式化慣例相關資訊。The class, which provides information about the formatting conventions of its associated culture. 方法會傳回本身的執行個體。The method returns an instance of itself. 如果並未提供實作格式化的方法來明確地所傳回物件使用代表目前執行緒文化特性的屬性。If an implementation is not provided to a formatting method explicitly, the object returned by the property that represents the current thread culture is used. 下列範例說明之間的關聯性介面和在格式化作業中的類別。The following example illustrates the relationship between the interface and the class in formatting operations. 它會定義自訂實作其方法會顯示在格式化作業所要求的物件型別。It defines a custom implementation whose method displays the type of the object requested by the formatting operation. 如果它要求物件，此方法提供目前執行緒文化特性的物件。If it is requesting a object, the method provides the object for the current thread culture. 做為範例所示，從輸出方法要求物件，提供格式設定資訊，而方法要求和物件，以及實作。As the output from the example shows, the method requests a object to provide formatting information, whereas the method requests and objects as well as an implementation. strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md), such as "d", "D", "f", and "F", are aliases that correspond to particular format pattern properties. strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md) are related to strings or substrings that a formatting operation inserts into the result stream. (請參閱[DateTimeFormatInfo 物件具現化](#instantiating)> 一節。)(See the [Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object](#instantiating) section.) 2. 修改屬性或屬性，用來產生所要的結果字串。Modify the property or properties that are used to produce the desired result string. (如需有關如何格式化方法的使用資訊屬性，以定義結果字串，請參閱上一節[格式化字串和 DateTimeFormatInfo 屬性](#properties)。)(For information about how formatting methods use properties to define result strings, see the previous section, [Format strings and DateTimeFormatInfo properties](#properties).) 3. 使用自訂物件建立為您格式化方法的呼叫中引數。Use the custom object you created as the argument in calls to formatting methods. 有兩種方式可變更的結果字串格式：There are two other ways to change the format of a result string: - 您可以使用類別來定義自訂的文化特性 （文化特性，都有唯一的名稱和的補充現有的文化特性） 或取代文化特性 （一個，而不是特定文化特性）。You can use the class to define either a custom culture (a culture that has a unique name and that supplements existing cultures) or a replacement culture (one that is used instead of a specific culture). 您可以儲存並以程式設計方式存取此文化特性，如同任何.NET Framework 所支援的物件。You can save and access this culture programmatically as you would any object supported by the .NET Framework. - 如果結果字串不區分文化特性，而且不會依照預先定義的格式，您可以使用自訂日期和時間格式字串。If the result string is not culture-sensitive and doesn't follow a predefined format, you can use a custom date and time format string. 例如，如果您要序列化 YYYYMMDDHHmmss 格式的日期和時間資料，您可以產生結果字串傳遞至自訂格式字串方法，而且您可以將結果字串的轉換回藉由呼叫的值方法。For example, if you are serializing date and time data in the format YYYYMMDDHHmmss, you can generate the result string by passing the custom format string to the method, and you can convert the result string back to a value by calling the method. ### 變更的簡短日期模式Changing the short date pattern 下列範例會變更"d"（簡短日期） 標準格式字串所產生的結果字串的格式。The following example changes the format of a result string produced by the "d" (short date) standard format string. 它會變更相關聯EN-US 或從其預設值是"yyyy/m /"以英文 （美國） 文化特性的屬性"yyyy'-"MM"-"dd"和"d"標準格式字串來顯示日期之前和之後會使用屬性變更。It changes the associated property for the en-US or English (United States) culture from its default of "M/d/yyyy" to "yyyy'-"MM"-"dd" and uses the "d" standard format string to display the date both before and after the property is changed. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/example1.cs#10)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/example1.vb#10)] ### 變更日期分隔符號字元Changing the date separator character 下列範例會變更的日期分隔符號字元物件，代表 FR-FR 文化特性的格式設定慣例。The following example changes the date separator character in a object that represents the formatting conventions of the fr-FR culture. 此範例使用"g"標準格式字串來顯示日期之前和之後屬性變更。The example uses the "g" standard format string to display the date both before and after the property is changed. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/example3.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/example3.vb#12)] ### 變更星期名稱縮寫和完整日期模式Changing day name abbreviations and the long date pattern 在某些情況下，完整日期模式中，通常會顯示完整日期和月份名稱，以及一天的月份和年份的數目，可能會太長。In some cases, the long date pattern, which typically displays the full day and month name along with the number of the day of the month and the year, may be too long. 下列範例會縮短 EN-US 文化特性，以傳回一個字元或兩個字元的星期名稱縮寫，後面接著一天的數字、 月份名稱縮寫和年份的完整日期模式。The following example shortens the long date pattern for the en-US culture to return a one-character or two-character day name abbreviation followed by the day number, the month name abbreviation, and the year. 其做法是指派至較短的星期名稱縮寫陣列，並藉由修改自訂格式字串指派給屬性。It does this by assigning shorter day name abbreviations to the array, and by modifying the custom format string assigned to the property. 這會影響結果字串，傳回的"D"和"f"標準格式字串。This affects the result strings returned by the "D" and "f" standard format strings. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/example2.cs#13)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/example2.vb#13)] 一般而言，若要變更屬性也會影響屬性，接著定義"F"標準格式字串所傳回的結果字串。Ordinarily, the change to the property also affects the property, which in turn defines the result string returned by the "F" standard format string. 為了保留原始的完整日期和時間模式，此範例會重新指派原始的自訂格式字串指派給屬性之後屬性修改。To preserve the original full date and time pattern, the example reassigns the original custom format string assigned to the property after the property is modified. ### 從 （12 小時制） 變更為 24 小時制Changing from a 12-hour clock to a 24-hour clock 針對許多在.NET Framework 中的文化特性的時間，以使用 12 小時制和 AM/PM 指示項。For many cultures in the .NET Framework, the time is expressed by using a 12-hour clock and an AM/PM designator. 下列範例會定義`ReplaceWith24HourClock`取代任何使用 24 小時制的格式會使用 12 小時制的時間格式的方法。The following example defines a `ReplaceWith24HourClock` method that replaces any time format that uses a 12-hour clock with a format that uses a 24-hour clock. A.D. （如下）。(Anno Domini). 此範例變更西元紀元名稱The example changes the era name to C.E. （常見紀元） 來取代指派給格式字串中的"g"自訂格式規範具有常值字串屬性。(Common Era) by replacing the "g" custom format specifier in the format string assigned to the property with a literal string. 常值字串的使用方式不必要的因為紀元名稱通常由從.NET Framework 或 Windows 作業系統所提供的文化特性資料表中的私用資料的方法。The use of a literal string is necessary, because the era name is typically returned by the method from private data in the culture tables supplied by either the .NET Framework or the Windows operating system. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/example4.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/example4.vb#11)] ## 剖析日期和時間字串Parsing date and time strings 剖析涉及將轉換的日期和時間的字串表示或值。Parsing involves converting the string representation of a date and time to a or value. 這兩種類型包括`Parse`， `TryParse`， `ParseExact`，和`TryParseExact`方法，以支援剖析作業。Both of these types include the `Parse`, `TryParse`, `ParseExact`, and `TryParseExact` methods to support parsing operations. `Parse`和`TryParse`方法轉換可以有各種不同的格式字串，而`ParseExact`和`TryParseExact`需要字串具有定義的格式。The `Parse` and `TryParse` methods convert a string that can have a variety of formats, whereas `ParseExact` and `TryParseExact` require that the string have a defined format or formats. 如果在剖析作業失敗，`Parse`和`ParseExact`擲回例外狀況，而`TryParse`和`TryParseExact`傳回`false`。If the parsing operation fails, `Parse` and `ParseExact` throw an exception, whereas `TryParse` and `TryParseExact` return `false`. 剖析方法隱含或明確地使用列舉值，以決定哪些 （例如前置、 尾端，或內部空白字元） 的樣式項目中可以存在的字串剖析，以及如何解譯剖析的字串或任何遺漏項目。The parsing methods implicitly or explicitly use a enumeration value to determine which style elements (such as leading, trailing, or inner white space) can be present in the string to be parsed, and how to interpret the parsed string or any missing elements. 如果您沒有提供值，當您呼叫`Parse`或`TryParse`方法，預設值是，這是包含的複合樣式， ，和旗標。If you don't provide a value when you call the `Parse` or `TryParse` method, the default is , which is a composite style that includes the , , and flags. 如`ParseExact`和`TryParseExact`方法，預設值是; 輸入的字串必須對應到特定的自訂日期和時間格式字串的精確。For the `ParseExact` and `TryParseExact` methods, the default is ; the input string must correspond precisely to a particular custom date and time format string. 剖析方法也會隱含或明確地使用物件，定義特定的符號和模式可能會發生在要剖析的字串。The parsing methods also implicitly or explicitly use a object that defines the specific symbols and patterns that can occur in the string to be parsed. 如果您沒有提供物件物件預設會使用目前執行緒文化特性。If you don't provide a object, the object for the current thread culture is used by default. 如需剖析日期和時間字串的詳細資訊，請參閱個別的剖析方法，例如， ， ，和。For more information about parsing date and time strings, see the individual parsing methods, such as , , , and . 下列範例說明剖析的日期和時間字串的區分文化特性的本質。The following example illustrates the culture-sensitive nature of parsing date and time strings. 它會嘗試使用 EN-US EN-GB、 FR-FR、 及的 FI-FI 文化特性的慣例來剖析兩個日期的字串。It tries to parse two date strings by using the conventions of the en-US, en-GB, fr-FR, and fi-FI cultures. 日期，這會解譯為 8/18/2014 中是 EN-US 文化特性會擲回18 解譯為月數，因此，文化特性中其他三個例外狀況。The date that is interpreted as 8/18/2014 in the en-US culture throws a exception in the other three cultures because 18 is interpreted as the month number. 2015 年 1 月 2 日會剖析 EN-US 文化特性的第一個月的第二天，但其餘的文化特性的第二個月的第一天。1/2/2015 is parsed as the second day of the first month in the en-US culture, but as the first day of the second month in the remaining cultures. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/parsing1.cs#15)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/parsing1.vb#15)] 通常剖析日期和時間字串的原因有兩個：Date and time strings are typically parsed for two reasons: - 若要將使用者輸入轉換成日期和時間值。To convert user input into a date and time value. - 若要反覆存取日期和時間值。也就是說，還原序列化先前序列化為字串的日期和時間值。To round-trip a date and time value; that is, to deserialize a date and time value that was previously serialized as a string. 下列章節會討論這些更詳細地的兩個作業。The following sections discuss these two operations in greater detail. ### 剖析使用者字串Parsing user strings 當您剖析使用者輸入的日期和時間字串時，您應該一律具現化反映使用者的文化特性設定，包括使用者所做的任何自訂的物件。When you parse date and time strings input by the user, you should always instantiate a object that reflects the user's cultural settings, including any customizations the user may have made. 否則，日期和時間物件可能有不正確的值。Otherwise, the date and time object may have incorrect values. 如需有關如何具現化資訊物件，以反映使用者文化特性的自訂設定，請參閱[DateTimeFormatInfo 和動態資料](#dynamic)> 一節。For information about how to instantiate a object that reflects user cultural customizations, see the [DateTimeFormatInfo and dynamic data](#dynamic) section. 下列範例說明剖析作業中，以反映使用者文化特性設定，與另一個沒有之間的差異。The following example illustrates the difference between a parsing operation that reflects user cultural settings and one that does not. 在此情況下，預設系統文化特性是 EN-US，但使用者使用控制台中**地區和語言**從其預設值是"yyyy/m /"變更"yy/MM/dd"簡短日期模式。In this case, the default system culture is en-US, but the user has used Control Panel, **Region and Language** to change the short date pattern from its default of "M/d/yyyy" to "yy/MM/dd". 當使用者輸入反映使用者設定的字串，且所剖析的字串也會反映使用者設定 （覆寫） 的物件在剖析作業會傳回正確的結果。When the user enters a string that reflects user settings, and the string is parsed by a object that also reflects user settings (overrides), the parsing operation returns a correct result. 不過，當字串會剖析物件，以反映標準 EN-US 文化特性設定，則剖析方法會擲回例外狀況因為它會解譯 14 的月份，數目不兩位數的年份。However, when the string is parsed by a object that reflects standard en-US cultural settings, the parsing method throws a exception because it interprets 14 as the number of the month, not the last two digits of the year. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/parse2.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/parse2.vb#16)] ### 序列化和還原序列化的日期和時間資料Serializing and deserializing date and time data 序列化來回; 預期的日期和時間資料也就是說，所有序列化和還原序列化的值應該相同。Serialized date and time data are expected to round-trip; that is, all serialized and deserialized values should be identical. 如果日期和時間值代表單一時間點，已還原序列化的值應該代表不論文化特性或其已還原的系統時區的時間在同一時間。If a date and time value represents a single moment in time, the deserialized value should represent the same moment in time regardless of the culture or time zone of the system on which it was restored. 若要反覆存取日期和時間資料成功，您必須使用慣例的文化特性而異，傳回屬性，產生及剖析資料。To round-trip date and time data successfully, you must use the conventions of the invariant culture, which is returned by the property, to generate and parse the data. 格式化和剖析作業應該不會反映出預設文化特性的慣例。The formatting and parsing operations should never reflect the conventions of the default culture. 如果您使用預設文化特性設定，可攜性的資料會嚴格限制;它可以是只在其文化特性特有的設定都與在其上已序列化之執行緒的執行緒上已成功還原序列化。If you use default cultural settings, the portability of the data is strictly limited; it can be successfully deserialized only on a thread whose cultural-specific settings are identical to those of the thread on which it was serialized. 在某些情況下，這表示，資料無法甚至成功序列化和還原序列化的相同系統上。In some cases, this means that the data cannot even be successfully serialized and deserialized on the same system. 如果日期和時間值的時間元件十分重要，應該也將轉換為 UTC 並使用"o"或"r"序列化[標準格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。If the time component of a date and time value is significant, it should also be converted to UTC and serialized by using the "o" or "r" [standard format string](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md). [時間] 資料便可以還原，藉由呼叫剖析方法並將它傳遞為文化特性而異的適當的格式字串沿著`provider`引數。The time data can then be restored by calling a parsing method and passing it the appropriate format string along with the invariant culture as the `provider` argument. 下列範例說明反覆存取日期和時間值的程序。The following example illustrates the process of round-tripping a date and time value. 它會序列化的日期和時間會遵守美國的系統上太平洋時間和目前文化特性是 EN-US。It serializes a date and time on a system that observes U.S. Pacific time and whose current culture is en-US. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/serialize1.cs#17)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/serialize1.vb#17)] 還原序列化布魯塞爾，哥本哈根，馬德里，巴黎時區中的系統上的資料和目前文化特性為 fr-fr。It deserializes the data on a system in the Brussels, Copenhagen, Madrid and Paris time zone and whose current culture is fr-FR. 還原的日期是 9 個小時會反映八個小時 utc 時區調整為比 UTC 快一個小時的原始日期晚。The restored date is nine hours later than the original date, which reflects the time zone adjustment from eight hours behind UTC to one hour ahead of UTC. 原始日期和還原的日期表示相同時間點。Both the original date and the restored date represent the same moment in time. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/serialize2.cs#18)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/serialize2.vb#18)] ## Examples 下列範例會使用反映取得的屬性英文 （美國） 文化特性的物件。The following example uses reflection to get the properties of the object for the English (United States) culture. 它會顯示包含自訂格式字串的那些屬性的值，並使用這些字串來顯示格式的日期。It displays the value of those properties that contain custom format strings and uses those strings to display formatted dates. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個建構函式會建立物件，代表文化特性而異的日期和時間資訊。This constructor creates a object that represents the date and time information of the invariant culture. 若要建立特定文化特性物件，請建立該文化特性的物件，並擷取所傳回的物件及其屬性。To create a object for a specific culture, create a object for that culture and retrieve the object returned by its property. 內容可以修改這個建構函式所建立的物件。The properties of the object created by this constructor can be modified. 不過，您無法修改屬性，因為而異的文化特性支援西曆的當地語系化的版本。However, you cannot modify the property, because the invariant culture supports only a localized version of the Gregorian calendar. 若要建立物件，使用特定的行事曆，您必須具現化支援之物件的行事曆，並將指派的行事曆屬性所傳回的物件屬性.To create a object that uses a specific calendar, you must instantiate a object that supports that calendar and assign the calendar to the property of the object returned by the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在某些語言中，屬於日期的月份名稱會出現在所有格。In some languages, a month name that is part of a date appears in the genitive case. 例如，RU-RU 或俄文 （俄羅斯） 文化特性的日期所組成的日數和所有格的月份名稱，例如 1 Января （1 年 1 月）。For example, a date in the ru-RU or Russian (Russia) culture consists of the day number and the genitive month name, such as 1 Января (1 January). 對於這些文化特性，自訂格式字串"MMM"格式規範，如果或方法包含的適當成員取代"MMM"結果字串中的陣列。For these cultures, if a custom format string includes the "MMM" format specifier, the or method includes the appropriate member of the array in place of the "MMM" in the result string. 設定作業中，陣列必須是一維完全 13 個元素，因為物件容納有 13 個月的行事曆。In a set operation, the array must be one-dimensional with exactly 13 elements, because objects accommodate calendars that have 13 months. 第十三個元素應該是具有 12 個月的行事曆， 。For calendars that have 12 months, the thirteenth element should be . （索引位置為零的項目） 的第一個項目代表一年所定義的第一個月屬性。The first element (the element at index zero) represents the first month of the year defined by the property. 如果您設定屬性，您也必須設定屬性。If you set the property, you must also set the property. ## Examples 下列範例會建立讀取/寫入物件，代表英文 （美國） 文化特性，並指派縮寫所有格的月份名稱及其和屬性。The following example creates a read/write object that represents the English (United States) culture and assigns abbreviated genitive month names to its and properties. 然後，它會顯示日期包含文化特性的支援日曆中的每個月份的縮寫的月份名稱的字串表示。It then displays the string representation of dates that include the abbreviated month name of each month in the culture's supported calendar. remarks.format: ## Remarks 複製為可寫入即使原始物件是唯讀的。The clone is writable even if the original object is read-only. 因此，複製的內容可以修改與使用者定義的模式。Therefore, the properties of the clone can be modified with user-defined patterns. 物件的淺層複本是只是物件的副本。A shallow copy of an object is a copy of the object only. 如果物件包含其他物件的參考，則淺層複製不會建立參考物件的複本。If the object contains references to other objects, the shallow copy does not create copies of the referred objects. 它改為參考原始物件。It refers to the original objects instead. 相較之下，物件的複本，以及該物件直接或間接參考的所有項目會建立物件的深層複本。In contrast, a deep copy of an object creates a copy of the object and a copy of everything directly or indirectly referenced by that object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會傳回陣列，其中包含對應至標準格式字串的所有自訂格式字串。This method returns an array that contains all custom format strings that correspond to standard format strings. 請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)標準格式字串的清單。See [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) for a list of the standard format strings. 您可以使用自訂格式字串中所傳回的陣列在格式化作業中的方法。You can use the custom format strings in the array returned by the method in formatting operations. 不過，如果您這樣做，日期和時間值的字串表示傳回，格式化作業不一定要剖析成功地`Parse`和`TryParse`方法。However, if you do, the string representation of a date and time value returned in that formatting operation cannot always be parsed successfully by the `Parse` and `TryParse` methods. 因此，您不能假設的自訂格式字串由方法可以用來反覆存取日期和時間值。Therefore, you cannot assume that the custom format strings returned by the method can be used to round-trip date and time values. 下列範例說明此問題。The following example illustrates this problem. 它會擷取包含義大利 （義大利文） 文化特性格式資訊的物件。It retrieves a object that contains formatting information for the Italy (Italian) culture. 將每個自訂格式字串中所傳回的陣列傳遞方法方法來建立日期和時間的字串表示。It passes each custom format string in the array returned by the method to the method to create the string representation of a date and time. 這個範例會嘗試剖析此值，藉由呼叫方法。This example then attempts to parse this value by calling the method. 範例輸出所示，某些自訂格式字串不會產生日期和時間值也會成功反覆存取。As the output from the example shows, some of the custom format strings do not produce a date and time value that successfully round-trips. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.GetAllDateTimePatterns#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.getalldatetimepatterns/cs/getalldatetimepatternsex1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.GetAllDateTimePatterns#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.getalldatetimepatterns/vb/getalldatetimepatternsex1.vb#1)] 若要剖析的日期和時間，可以用來表示的預先定義的自訂格式的數字的字串表示，呼叫下列方法之一：To parse the string representation of a date and time that can be expressed in a number of predefined custom formats, call one of the following methods: - - - - 傳回陣列中的自訂格式字串方法取決於其文化特性的現行曆法物件可提供格式設定資訊。The custom format strings in the array returned by the method depends on the current calendar of the culture for which the object supplies formatting information. 如果變更行事曆，這個方法所傳回的陣列，也會變更。If the calendar changes, the array returned by this method also changes. ## Examples 下列範例會顯示日期和時間格式字串而異的文化特性，以及產生時，格式字串用來設定特定的日期格式的結果字串。The following example displays the date and time format strings for the invariant culture, as well as the result string that is produced when that format string is used to format a particular date. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.GetAllDateTimePatterns#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.getalldatetimepatterns/cs/getalldatetimepatternsinv.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.GetAllDateTimePatterns#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.getalldatetimepatterns/vb/getalldatetimepatternsinv.vb#3)] 此範例會具現化物件，代表文化特性而異，藉由呼叫建構函式。The example instantiates a object that represents the invariant culture by calling the constructor. 它也可以擷取，代表從而異的文化特性屬性。It could also retrieve a that represents the invariant culture from the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個屬性不會變更，不論目前的文化特性。This property does not change, regardless of the current culture. 因為這個緣故，文化特性而異的物件可以用來產生一致、 文化特性無關的結果，在剖析及格式為多重文化特性的資料上作業。Because of this, the invariant culture's object can be used to produce consistent, culture-independent results in parsing and formatting operations on data that is multi-cultural. 例如，如果多個文化特性的日期和時間資料是以字串形式保存，它可以進行格式化使用而異的文化特性的物件和已儲存。For example, if date and time data from multiple cultures is to be persisted in string form, it can be formatted by using the object of the invariant culture and saved. 它會剖析使用因文化特性而異的物件。It can then be parsed by using the invariant culture's object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性定義特定文化特性的格式的呼叫所傳回的日期字串和方法而由複合格式字串時，會提供"D"標準格式字串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "D" standard format string. 下列範例將說明下列之間的關聯性:"D"標準格式字串中，自訂格式字串所傳回屬性和日期的特定文化特性的表示法。The following example illustrates the relationships among the following: the "D" standard format string, the custom format string returned by the property, and the culture-specific representation of a date. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern/CS/longdatepattern1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern/VB/longdatepattern1.vb#2)] 請參閱[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)為可以組合來建構例如"dddd，dd MMMM yyyy"自訂格式字串的個別的自訂格式規範。See [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md) for individual custom format specifiers that can be combined to construct custom format strings such as "dddd, dd MMMM yyyy". 您應該完全相符的字串，而不是使用日期分隔符號預留位置完整日期模式中設定日期分隔符號。You should set the date separator in the long date pattern to an exact string instead of using the date separator placeholder. 例如，若要取得模式 MM DD yyyy，設定為 「 MM-DD yyyy 的"的完整日期模式。For example, to obtain the pattern MM-DD-yyyy, set the long date pattern to "MM-DD-yyyy". 如果文化特性變更所使用的行事曆，可以變更這個屬性的值。The value of this property may change if the calendar used by a culture changes. 例如，下列範例示範如何屬性表示阿拉伯文 （敘利亞） 文化特性物件時變更文化特性變更所使用的物件。For instance, the following example shows how the property of a object that represents the Arabic (Syria) culture changes when the object used by the culture changes. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern/CS/longdatepattern2.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern/VB/longdatepattern2.vb#3)] ## Examples 下列範例顯示的值一些文化特性的屬性。The following example displays the value of the property for a few cultures. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在某些語言中，屬於日期的月份名稱會出現在所有格。In some languages, a month name that is part of a date appears in the genitive case. 比方說，日期之俄文 （俄羅斯） 或 「 RU-RU"，文化特性是由日數字和所有格的月份名稱，例如 1 Января。For example, a date in the Russian (Russia) or "ru-RU", culture consists of the day number and the genitive month name, such as 1 Января. 當設定這個屬性時，陣列必須是一維陣列，而且必須完全 13 個元素。When this property is set, the array must be one-dimensional and must have exactly 13 elements. 物件會容納具有 13 個月的行事曆。 objects accommodate calendars with 13 months. （索引位置為零的項目） 的第一個項目代表一年所定義的第一個月屬性。如果您設定屬性，您也必須設定屬性。The first element (the element at index zero) represents the first month of the year defined by the property.If you set the property, you must also set the property. ## Examples 下列範例會示範數個方法和屬性，指定日期和時間格式模式，原生的行事曆名稱和完整和縮寫月份和星期幾名稱。The following example demonstrates several methods and properties that specify date and time format patterns, native calendar name, and full and abbreviated month and day names. remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性用於針對所有從 12:00:00 （中午） 到時間 23:59:59.999。The property is used for all times from 12:00:00 (noon) to 23:59:59.999. 如果自訂的模式包括格式模式"tt"，而時間是正午以後，顯示的值取代"tt"中的格式模式。If the custom pattern includes the format pattern "tt" and the time is after noon, displays the value of in place of the "tt" in the format pattern. 如果自訂模式包含格式模式"t"，第一個字元的隨即出現。If the custom pattern includes the format pattern "t", only the first character of is displayed. 您的應用程式應該使用"tt"語言，是為了維護 AM 和 PM 之間的差別。Your application should use "tt" for languages for which it is necessary to maintain the distinction between AM and PM. 其中一種就是日文，日文的 AM 和 PM 指示項的第二個字元 (非第一個字元) 不同。An example is Japanese, for which the AM and PM designators differ in the second character instead of the first character. 不使用 PM 指示項的文化特性，這個屬性會傳回空字串。For cultures that do not use a PM designator, this property returns an empty string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性定義特定文化特性的格式的呼叫所傳回的日期字串和方法而由複合格式字串時，會提供"r"和"R"標準格式字串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "r" and "R" standard format strings. RFC1123 模式反映已定義的標準，且屬性為唯讀。The RFC1123 pattern reflects a defined standard, and the property is read-only. 因此，它一律為相同，不論文化特性。Therefore, it is always the same, regardless of the culture. 自訂格式字串為 "ddd, dd MMM yyyy HH':'mm':'ss 'GMT'"。The custom format string is "ddd, dd MMM yyyy HH':'mm':'ss 'GMT'". ## Examples 下列範例顯示一些文化特性 RFC1123Pattern 值。The following example displays the value of RFC1123Pattern for a few cultures. span.span: An array of custom format strings.

param.name: format
param.span: patterns 參數中所指定的與自訂格式字串建立關聯的標準格式字串。

summary.span: 設定對應於指定之標準格式字串的自訂日期和時間格式字串。

span.span: Sets the custom date and time format strings that correspond to a specified standard format string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法為特定標準日期和時間格式字串定義對應的自訂格式字串。The method defines the custom format strings that correspond to a particular standard date and time format string. 如果呼叫的日期和時間格式化方法包含的標準日期和時間格式字串所指定`format`，此方法會使用中的第一個項目`patterns`以定義結果字串的格式陣列。If a call to a date and time formatting method includes the standard date and time format string specified by `format`, the method uses the first element in the `patterns` array to define the format of the resulting string. > [!WARNING] > `Parse`和`TryParse`方法不完全重複中的所有字串`patterns`時剖析的日期和時間的字串表示。The `Parse` and `TryParse` methods do not fully iterate all strings in `patterns` when parsing the string representation of a date and time. 如果您需要在剖析作業中具有特定格式的日期和時間字串，您應該傳遞至有效的格式陣列， ， ，或方法。If you require a date and time string to have particular formats in a parsing operation, you should pass the array of valid formats to the , , , or method. 您可以定義自訂格式字串會對應至"d"、"D"、"t"、"T"和"y"或"Y"標準日期和時間格式字串。You can define custom format strings that correspond to the "d", "D", "t", "T", and "y" or "Y" standard date and time format strings. 如果值`format`為其他任何標準格式字串，方法會擲回。If the value of `format` is any other standard format string, the method throws an . 如果您的自訂日期和時間格式字串包含日期分隔符號，您應該明確指定為日期分隔符號，而不是依賴具有特定日期分隔符號會取代"/"自訂格式規範的剖析或格式化方法。If your custom date and time format strings include date separators, you should explicitly specify a date separator instead of relying on the parsing or formatting method that replaces the "/" custom format specifier with a particular date separator. 比方說，若要取得模式 MM DD yyyy，使用 「 公釐-DD yyyy 的 」 的模式。For example, to obtain the pattern MM-DD-yyyy, use the pattern "MM-DD-yyyy". ## Examples 下列範例會具現化物件代表"EN-US"（英文-美國） 文化特性，並使用它來剖析的日期和時間使用"Y"標準格式字串的字串陣列。The following example instantiates a object that represents the "en-US" (English - United States) culture and uses it to parse an array of date and time strings using the "Y" standard format string. 然後它會使用方法使新的自訂格式字串為"Y"標準格式字串，並嘗試剖析日期和時間字串的陣列。It then uses the method to associate a new custom format string with the "Y" standard format string, and then attempts to parse the array of date and time strings. 範例輸出所示範新的自訂格式字串在剖析和格式化作業中使用。Output from the example demonstrates that the new custom format string is used in both the parsing and formatting operations. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.SetAllDateTimePatterns#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.setalldatetimepatterns/cs/setalldatetimepatterns.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.SetAllDateTimePatterns#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.setalldatetimepatterns/vb/setalldatetimepatterns.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性定義特定文化特性的格式的呼叫所傳回的日期字串和方法而由複合格式字串時，會提供"d"標準格式字串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "d" standard format string. 如果這個屬性會受影響的值屬性變更。This property is affected if the value of the property changes. ## Examples 下列範例顯示的值使用屬性和日期值格式化一些文化特性的屬性。The following example displays the value of the property and the value of a date formatted using the property for a few cultures. summary.span: 取得或設定簡短時間值的自訂格式字串。

span.span: Gets or sets the custom format string for a short time value.

value.span: 簡短時間值的自訂格式字串。

span.span: The custom format string for a short time value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性定義特定文化特性的格式的呼叫所傳回的日期字串和方法而由複合格式字串時，會提供"t"標準格式字串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "t" standard format string. 我們建議您在完全相符的字串，而不是使用時間分隔符號預留位置簡短時間模式中設定的時間分隔符號。We recommend that you set the time separator in the short time pattern to an exact string instead of using the time separator placeholder. 例如，若要取得模式 h--分秒，設定簡短時間模式，以"h-mm-ss"。For example, to obtain the pattern h-mm-ss, set the short time pattern to "h-mm-ss". ## Examples 下列範例顯示的值少數的文化特性。The following example displays the value of for a few cultures. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.ShortTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.ShortTimePattern/CPP/dtfi_shorttimepattern.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.ShortTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.ShortTimePattern/CS/dtfi_shorttimepattern.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.ShortTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.ShortTimePattern/VB/dtfi_shorttimepattern.vb#1)]

summary.span: 取得可排序日期和時間值的自訂格式字串。

span.span: Gets the custom format string for a sortable date and time value.

value.span: 可排序日期和時間值的自訂格式字串。

span.span: The custom format string for a sortable date and time value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性定義特定文化特性的格式的呼叫所傳回的日期字串和方法而由複合格式字串時，會提供"s"標準格式字串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "s" standard format string. 所傳回的格式字串屬性會反映已定義的標準 (ISO 8601)，且屬性為唯讀。The format string returned by the property reflects a defined standard (ISO 8601), and the property is read-only. 因此，它一律為相同，不論文化特性。Therefore, it is always the same, regardless of the culture. 自訂格式字串為 "yyyy'-'MM'-'dd'T'HH':'mm':'ss"。The custom format string is "yyyy'-'MM'-'dd'T'HH':'mm':'ss". ## Examples 下列範例顯示的值少數的文化特性。The following example displays the value of for a few cultures. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.SortableDateTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.SortableDateTimePattern/CPP/dtfi_sortabledatetimepattern.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.SortableDateTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.SortableDateTimePattern/CS/dtfi_sortabledatetimepattern.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.SortableDateTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.SortableDateTimePattern/VB/dtfi_sortabledatetimepattern.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ TimeSeparator { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

summary.span: 取得或設定分隔時間組成部分 (即時、分和秒) 的字串。

span.span: Gets or sets the string that separates the components of time, that is, the hour, minutes, and seconds.

value.span: 分隔時間組成部分的字串。

span.span: The string that separates the components of time.

value.span: 的預設值為 ":"。

span.span: The default for is ":".

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果自訂模式包含的格式模式":"，顯示的值取代":"中的格式模式。If the custom pattern includes the format pattern ":", displays the value of in place of the ":" in the format pattern. 時間分隔符號衍生自屬性。The time separator is derived from the property. 我們建議您簡單地說設定時間分隔符號，或長時間模式，而不是使用時間分隔符號預留位置完全相符的字串。We recommend that you set the time separator in short or long time patterns to an exact string instead of using the time separator placeholder. 例如，若要取得模式 h--分秒，設定模式，以"h-mm-ss"。For example, to obtain the pattern h-mm-ss, set the pattern to "h-mm-ss". 這種做法也可讓您設定模式，例如"h'h ' mm am 'ss'"(3 h 36 m 12s)，包括多種類型的分隔符號。This practice also enables you to set patterns such as "h'h 'mm'm 'ss's'" (3h 36m 12s) that include multiple types of separators. 屬性定義取代時間分隔符號的字串 (":"自訂日期和時間格式規範) 在格式化作業中的結果字串中。The property defines the string that replaces the time separator (":" custom date and time format specifier) in a result string in a formatting operation. 它也會定義剖析作業中的時間分隔符號字串。It also defines the time separator string in a parsing operation. ## Examples 下列範例會具現化物件 EN-US 文化特性中，變更其日期分隔符號"。"，並使用"t"、"T"、"F"、"f"、"G"和"g"標準格式字串來顯示日期。The following example instantiates a object for the en-US culture, changes its date separator to ".", and displays a date by using the "t", "T", "F", "f", "G", and "g" standard format strings. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.TimeSeparator#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.timeseparator/cs/timeseparatorex.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.TimeSeparator#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.timeseparator/vb/timeseparatorex.vb#1)]

public: property System::String ^ UniversalSortableDateTimePattern { System::String ^ get(); };

summary.span: 取得國際標準、可排序日期和時間字串的自訂格式字串。

span.span: Gets the custom format string for a universal, sortable date and time string.

value.span: 國際標準、可排序日期和時間字串的自訂格式字串。

span.span: The custom format string for a universal, sortable date and time string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性定義的呼叫所傳回的日期字串格式和方法而由複合格式字串時，會提供"u"標準格式字串。The property defines the format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "u" standard format string. 它可以用來顯示日期和時間，以國際標準時間指示"Z"結尾的可排序順序。It can be used to display dates and times in a sortable order with the universal time designator "Z" at the end. 此格式為可排序，因為它使用前置零的年、 月、 日、 小時、 分鐘和秒。The format is sortable because it uses leading zeros for year, month, day, hour, minute, and second. 自訂格式字串 ("yyyy '-' MM'-' dd HH': 'mm': 'ss'Z'") 是相同的文化特性或格式提供者。The custom format string ("yyyy'-'MM'-'dd HH':'mm':'ss'Z'") is the same regardless of culture or format provider. 所傳回的格式字串屬性會反映已定義的標準，且屬性為唯讀。The format string returned by the property reflects a defined standard, and the property is read-only. 因此，它一律為相同，不論文化特性。Therefore, it is always the same, regardless of the culture. 自訂格式字串為 "yyyy'-'MM'-'dd HH':'mm':'ss'Z'"。The custom format string is "yyyy'-'MM'-'dd HH':'mm':'ss'Z'". ## Examples 下列範例顯示的值少數的文化特性。The following example displays the value of for a few cultures. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern/CPP/dtfi_universalsortabledatetimepattern.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern/CS/dtfi_universalsortabledatetimepattern.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern/VB/dtfi_universalsortabledatetimepattern.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ YearMonthPattern { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

summary.span: 取得或設定年份和月份值的自訂格式字串。

span.span: Gets or sets the custom format string for a year and month value.

value.span: 年份和月份值的自訂格式字串。

span.span: The custom format string for a year and month value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性定義特定文化特性的格式的呼叫所傳回的日期字串和方法而由複合格式字串時，會提供"y"和"Y"標準格式字串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "y" and "Y" standard format strings. 如果這個屬性會受影響的值屬性變更。This property is affected if the value of the property changes. 我們建議您在完全相符的字串，而不是使用日期分隔符號預留位置年度月份模式中設定日期分隔符號。We recommend that you set the date separator in the year month pattern to an exact string instead of using the date separator placeholder. 例如，若要取得模式 MM yyyy，設定年月模式為"MM yyyy"。For example, to get the pattern MM-yyyy, set the year month pattern to "MM-yyyy". ## Examples 下列範例顯示的值少數的文化特性。The following example displays the value of for a few cultures. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.YearMonthPattern#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.YearMonthPattern/CPP/dtfi_yearmonthpattern.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.YearMonthPattern#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.YearMonthPattern/CS/dtfi_yearmonthpattern.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.YearMonthPattern#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.YearMonthPattern/VB/dtfi_yearmonthpattern.vb#1)]
